Label: Atlantic
Sound Notes: Plays solid on AT-LP120; some pops, still lively

Label: Asylum
Sound Notes: Crackly, vinyl feels thin, but plays without skips

Label: Dunhill / ABC
Sound Notes: Surprisingly lively; 'I've Never Been to Spain' sounds fantastic

Label: Aftermath/Interscope/UMe
Sound Notes: Incredible dynamics with SVS at -12 dB; 'Rap God' is a showcase

Label: Blackened Recordings
Sound Notes: Classic wall of sound; 'Enter Sandman' and 'Sad But True' slam

Label: EMI Nashville
Sound Notes: Blue vinyl plays clean; warm vocals, solid midrange

Label: Atlantic/Rhino
Sound Notes: Remaster sharpens guitars, Weiland’s vocals clear

Label: Geffen/UMe
Sound Notes: Haunting, raw vocals, acoustic guitars warm and present

Label: Warner Records
Sound Notes: Earthy, intimate, feels like a live set

Label: Republic/UMe
Sound Notes: Soulful, horns and rhythm section punchy, vocals raw and smooth

Label: Columbia
Sound Notes: Modern pop with punchy beats, bass-heavy, layered vocals

Label: Warner Bros.
Sound Notes: Warm, detailed, 'Into the Mystic' transcendent; all-time favorite

Label: Atlantic/Rhino
Sound Notes: Crisp, powerful; 'Stairway' and 'Levee' sound huge

Label: Big Loud/Mercury/Republic
Sound Notes: Solid mastering across 3 LPs; clear, dynamic

Album Title: One Thing at a Time (Bone White Edition)
Label: Big Loud/Mercury/Republic
Sound Notes: Bone White discs play clean, bass-forward, looks sharp on shelf

Label: Atlantic
Sound Notes: STP is my favorite grunge band of the 90s. I got Core for Christmas one year, not even knowing who they were — it became my coming-of-age soundtrack.

Label: Gasoline Alley / Geffen / Skunk Records
Sound Notes: Reminds me of riding around Derry, NH as a teenager with nothing to do and nowhere to go.

Label: The Bicycle Music Company
Sound Notes: Great album, but The Downward Spiral is Reznor’s masterpiece, IMO.

Label: Columbia / Sony / Legacy
Sound Notes: Not my favorite AIC album (that’s Jar of Flies). I was stationed in Tacoma, WA when Layne died in Seattle. Sad story, like too many artists.

Label: Sony / Epic / Legacy
Sound Notes: Punchy and dynamic; 'Daughter' and 'Animal' shine. Legacy reissue is solid, but an original ’93 would be a grail.
